monogr.title: A Treatise of Algebra, both historical and practical. Shewing, the Original, Progress, and Advancement thereof, from time to time; and by what Steps it hath atteined to the Heighth at which now it is. With some additional treatises I. Of the Cono-Cuneus; being a Body representing in part a Conus, in part a Cuneus. II. of Angular Sections; and other things relating thereunto, and to Trigonometry. III. of the Angle of Cntact; with other things appertaining to the Composition of Magnitudes, the Inceptives of Magnitudes, and the Composition of Motions, with the Results thereof. IV. Of Combination, Alternations, and Aliquot Parts
